fields.description:
Right now we just check for chrome. See github issue. 


Even though this was an on purpose design choice. 

From the docs at 13.3.0...

By default the grid will use the browser provided date picker for Chrome (as we think it's nice), but for all other browser it will just provide a simple text field. You can provide your chosen date picker to ag-Grid. This is done by providing a custom Date Component via the grid property dateComponent as follows:
fields.summary: Allow forcing type date for the column no matter what browser

fields.description:
when you refresh the grid, it stops currently editing cells from editing.

this is a problem if, eg, you are tabbing between editing cells, and you want some cells to change color as you edit (cellClassRules) so you call refresh() after the edit, however this takes the next cell you tabbed into out of edit mode.

Niall Note - i have asked the forum user if this is still a problem
fields.summary: Allow for refreshing not to impact currently editing cells

fields.description:
Raised by Sophia:

sophialazarova [8:46 AM] 
I have smth for you guys! I consider this to be a bug or at least inconsistent behavior. For example, we group by "country" by dragging the country column to the top, we can see that the entries are grouped by country and the "country" field disappears from the child entries since it becomes the name of the group. However, when we decide to group again by country but by clicking the context menu of the "country" column and choosing "group by country", the "country" field doesn't disappear from the child entries and it's visible both as group name and as field for every child.


[8:46] 
http://recordit.co/89jmd4QxyK
fields.summary: Grouping by drag and drop, and grouping by column menu have different behaviour. Make them consistent

fields.description:
See http://plnkr.co/edit/9pyyGuvIFctG7vwEYMHt?p=preview

If you edit the mood column (scroll right) then up/down will be output in the console, but home/page up/down will be ignored

We should allow the user to ignore all keyboard events I think.

Niall Note - the page up / down keys are not cell events - they are grid panel events - that is why they are not provided as part of this callback. To implement this, would need to reconsider the design, so the grid panel keys somehow also call this - which is a bit tricky, as the grid panel doesn't necessarily have an associated colDef.
fields.summary: extend suppressKeyboardEvent to page scroll events (home/end)

fields.description:
https://ag-grid.com/forum/showthread.php?tid=5373

from the user:

"Most grids that i have used in the passed have an option for sticky groups. So when you group by a certain column and start scrolling the group header sticks to the top of the grid until the next group is hit.

This is extremely helpful for our users when each group contains thousands of records (so they dont get lost).

Any chance this could be considered?

You can check Devexpress or Kendo UI for sticky group examples (they do it well)"
fields.summary: [sticky groups] have opened group rows float

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.description:
Not necessary to implement, just a suggestion of from the forum.

niall note: i have learned a lot since implementing floating rows. it should be possible to positing the floating rows on the top of the body container, similar to how the fullwidth panel does it.
